2568475b-e8fd-4464-85df-2cd03430a82a: Brace for Impact! also allows the Navy {g|Encyclopedia:CareerLeaderGlossary}officer{/g} to use any {g|Encyclopedia:Range}ranged{/g} weapon in threatened areas, knocks enemies {g|Encyclopedia:ProneEffect}prone{/g}, and pushes them 1 cell away during the effect.
9addadd3-da9b-45a1-bf4b-b82a51211347: Machine Spirit Communion applies 1 stack of {g|Encyclopedia:Exploit}exploit{/g} on all affected enemies.
4b8653d9-102a-46bf-8268-0488ac5f6500: Note: damaging psyker powers count as weapon attacks, counting toward the normal attack limit per {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g} and gaining all the benefits of {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g} increasing the {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} of attacks. For example, a Soldier using the Run and Gun ability will be able to use damaging psyker powers twice per {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}, and an {g|Encyclopedia:CareerAdeptGlossary}Operative{/g}'s Analyse Enemies ability affects the damage of damaging psyker powers.
729ec4e5-4b33-4470-a1bb-a2f74a494611: A Child of Asuryan who has chosen the Path of the Outcast and willingly left their craftworld to wander and explore the cosmos. Outcasts are masters of survival and skilled sharpshooters who prefer to destroy their {g|Encyclopedia:Prey}prey{/g} from afar.
a73ff572-f0ed-44b3-94dc-73947e1abd58: A Dracon is a commander within the hierarchy of a Drukhari Kabal who leads the most audacious raids into realspace. Those who rise to this status are known for their remarkable combat {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talents{/g} and are cruel and cunning enough to keep both their position and their life.
c825d72c-7f69-42e5-a66f-455478860ea9: A hive world's population is so dense that great swathes of the surface of the world are frequently covered in gargantuan cities bejewelled with towering spires that pierce the atmosphere. Hive worlds are vital to the welfare of the Imperium and are the beating heart of its economy and war machine. They produce munitions for the Emperor's armies in vast manufactories, mine valuable minerals, and refine fuel for the Imperial Navy. Innumerable regiments of the Astra Militarum are raised from their massive populations as well.
f620f017-c092-445a-aac7-e183d0c692c1: A member of the Adeptus Mechanicus and follower of the Machine Cult. Tech-Priests are initiated in the secrets of maintaining the most sacred and advanced technologies of the Imperium, which makes their contribution to Humanity's survival irreplaceable.
af9df8a6-561f-471f-8c9a-927e5988e33f: A psyker who has not undergone the sanctioning rituals designed to protect the psyker's soul from the machinations of the warp, yet still possesses an unfettered sorcerous gift.
fbf83947-cc5b-4c8d-aa7a-3b0460838f1d:
A voidborn character can reroll any failed attack, {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristic{/g}, or skill {g|Encyclopedia:Test}test{/g} with a 20% chance of success. This chance cannot be greater than the base success chance of the roll.
Additionally, any enemy dodge or parry against a voidborn character has a 20% chance to fail after a successful roll.
0b512609-a34e-4e88-b351-b20a7ff3f373: After triggering {g|Encyclopedia:PsychicPhenomena}psychic phenomena{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:PerilsOfWarp}perils of the warp{/g} first time each {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}, the psyker's next {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}psychic power{/g} costs −1 less {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}action point{/g}.
95256ff0-b6df-4be2-9e86-d978bde7abf2: All allies affected by Brace for Impact! do not suffer the {g|Encyclopedia:NegativeEffectTypesGlossary}negative effects{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeSuperiority}melee superiority{/g} for the entire combat. Melee Superiority: in melee combat, any target surrounded by more allies than enemies receives a +10 {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for each additional ally. Larger creatures need to be surrounded by more than two enemies to provide this advantage to the attackers.
5de6ebbf-a4e7-4e86-a7ca-e1b2a4972a8c: All allies affected by Brace for Impact! gain +30% to {g|Encyclopedia:DetailsOfTheCoverGlossary}cover penetration{/g}. The Navy {g|Encyclopedia:CareerLeaderGlossary}officer{/g} also permanently gains +15% to cover penetration.
dfb6c0fb-aa1d-467e-a51b-2b0076d51230: All allies affected by Brace for Impact! gain an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g} with 0 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} and 3 {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}MP{/g} and increase their {g|Encyclopedia:DetailsOfTheCoverGlossary}cover efficiency{/g} by +20% for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}.
f6767fcc-5d87-44df-bc97-7a23a2b1626c: All allies affected by Brace for Impact! suffer only half {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} from all {g|Encyclopedia:AttackOfOpportunityFullGlossary}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
dee6861e-4a13-4aca-9529-47929ea6ac4c: All allies, excluding xenos, in the current party gain +5 to the same {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristic{/g} as was chosen for Humanity's Finest.
5d34d17e-e3b4-48fc-86d9-cedac61d5585: All enemies in the {g|Encyclopedia:AreaOfEffect}area of effect{/g} of War Hymn of Furious Recital gain +1 stack of the {g|Encyclopedia:DisturbedEffect}disturbed{/g} effect. Enemies that are adjacent to the devotee gain +2 stacks of disturbed instead. Also, all daemons in the area of effect suffer {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} equal to the {g|Encyclopedia:MomentumWithDetailsGlossary}momentum{/g} restored to the devotee while using this {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g}.
70bfc2a1-d4bd-4e4f-8a86-a0b2bd72ed35: All {g|Encyclopedia:Range}ranged{/g} weapons dealing {g|Encyclopedia:PhysicalDamage}physical damage{/g} have +1 {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g}, +5% {g|Encyclopedia:ArmourPenetration}armour penetration{/g}, +1 {g|Encyclopedia:RateOfFire}rate of fire{/g}, and −5 to {g|Encyclopedia:Recoil}recoil{/g}.
70e848f1-8049-4474-8245-033f8d11cace: An Imperial world is one of a million planets united by the belief in the immortal God-Emperor. Hailing from hyper-technological societies to grimy feudal populations, the inhabitants of countless worlds offer fealty and devotion to the Master of Humanity and the Imperial Creed espoused by His servants. The designation "Imperial world" encompasses a vast array of wholly dissimilar worlds that are, nevertheless, part of the Imperium.
6a93bc3c-bc9c-4533-971a-126c87fe55b2: An enemy affected by sure-fire plan also suffers a −{uip|DodgeParryReduction|885ee31fc7ac49b9b75abd270004635d}% {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:ParryReduction}parry reduction{/g}.
3297bde9-0da4-4453-8602-e5693c6777e2: An error during the sanctioning process brought you many hours of agony, which nearly cost you your life.
563b277c-c04b-4c54-8d63-ad024d8e7ea1: An immeasurably vast domain hidden within the depths of the Webway — an enigmatic labyrinthine dimension that exists between the warp and realspace — Commorragh is the prime bastion of the Drukhari, a cruel and deadly xenos faction of the Aeldari. It is here that they devise plans for their raids into realspace — and weave their perpetual webs of intrigue against one another.
a3d6bb4b-e5f2-446f-8915-690f203dd911: An inauspicious deal with the wrong people resulted in the rise of a Chaos cult and the horrific massacre of innocents.
fee9b29f-aef7-4693-bcb3-8f4fd8954f91: Any time a voidborn character scores a {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit{/g}, there is a 10% chance to double the {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g}.
a90d048b-614f-4796-b974-7362e75f2b42:
Any time an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talent{/g} uses the {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerFellowship}Fellowship{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}, a voidborn character can instead use the {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerIntelligence}Intelligence{/g} bonus, if it is higher.
Additionally, voidborn characters can always upgrade Intelligence even if their {g|Encyclopedia:Career}archetype{/g} does not allow it.
817e7325-35e5-4084-9d75-e27555b71935: Any time the Commissar grants additional {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}movement points{/g} to any ally character, they give +2 movement points more.
556f35b1-e701-4274-8b8f-6d260c68d98e: As the commander-in-chief of a disastrous military campaign, you were buried in shame.
70480cce-67b0-4542-8a55-d7a0f5baebd8: At the end of their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}, fortress world characters gain stacks of never stop shooting equal to <u>(half the minimal {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} of the most damaging {g|Encyclopedia:Range}ranged{/g} weapon they used this {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g})</u>.
444f44f9-6270-4e37-ab8a-0d1b19902a60:
At the start of combat, the crime lord gains +{unit_stat|WarhammerIntelligence|bonus} stacks of the sure-fire plan effect. Activation of this {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g} consumes 1 stack and makes the next action stronger depending on the type of action:
-<indent=5%>If the crime lord attacks, they deal +{uip|AdditionalDamage|f8fbdb667b6a4dca814aec2bb5f14097}% more {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g}.</indent>
-<indent=5%>If the crime lord moves, they gain +{uip|AdditionalDodge|f8fbdb667b6a4dca814aec2bb5f14097}% {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} until the start of their next {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.</indent>
-<indent=5%>If the crime lord uses a non-damaging ability on an enemy, that enemy suffers a −{uip|AdditionalDamageTarget|f8fbdb667b6a4dca814aec2bb5f14097}% {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to damage for one {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}.</indent>
Can be used multiple times per turn.
9616cc5a-9d48-4a5f-ba90-d9363eebc791: Better to Die for the Emperor
e80aed46-98da-4050-a2d7-493c836869af: Biomancers specialise in manipulating biological energy and processes with the power of their minds. They are masters of the flesh, learning to shape and influence their own physical forms according to their will, as well as those of their allies and enemies.
f4f5f1d3-55fa-4cae-84e1-39a168385891: By destroying the very foundation of a heretical teaching, you brought down a dangerous schismatic sect.
8755683f-1952-4546-b30a-b2c2bc27be2e: Captured by heretics, you suffered unbearable torture at the hands of Humanity's enemies.
12882344-7b1f-4519-b24a-ebd48107ad11: Commissars of the Officio Prefectus are ruthless {g|Encyclopedia:CareerLeaderGlossary}officers{/g} charged with maintaining the morale, discipline, and fighting spirit of their Astra Militarum regiment. You used to be one of these faithful servants of the God-Emperor, a living symbol of Imperium authority, regarded with a mix of fear and awe by their subordinates.
0118e66f-09d5-4166-85d2-e71a3cd0c66b: Craftworlds are colossal vessels that carry the remnants of the once great and numerous Asuryani people through the darkness of the void, each craftworld a marvel of psycho-engineering and a self-sustaining abode. Over such long periods of isolation from the rest of their kin, even unique cultures have formed among the craftworlds' denizens.
2b27eb63-88c5-42d9-84a8-cee22f49a92a: Death world characters gain +10% to {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit chance{/g} for axes, hammers, and las weapons.
17901db7-c0b6-4dc2-aa2c-2afa6a3ce4cb: Death world characters gain +15% {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit chance{/g} against targets with the {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effect or with 50% or less of their {g|Encyclopedia:MaxWounds}maximum wounds{/g}.
723209da-07c6-4cf7-982e-866e10e7cf3e: Death world characters take {unit_stat|WarhammerToughness|bonus} less {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} from flame, {g|Encyclopedia:ToxicDamage}toxic damage{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:BleedingEffect}bleeding{/g} effects.
bbad9e8f-2b30-449d-8fc2-3510affb4fba: Diviners seek to discern the hidden past of the galaxy and know the course of events yet to come. These {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g} allow diviners to look into the twisting strands of the Immaterium in search of the answers they seek and sometimes even influence the outcome of fate itself.
31d86ec2-5137-4b41-85cb-e889c8b19804:
Each time a fortress world character kills an enemy, they gain +10 stacks of never stop shooting. At the start of their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}, there is a <u>(stacks of never stop shooting)</u>% chance that the first attack this {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g} will cost 0 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} and will not count toward the attack limit per round.
If this effect triggers, all the stacks are lost.
4613266f-fd10-4320-83da-0c0759fe55a1: Each {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g} fortress world characters gain a stacking +1% {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Range}ranged{/g} attacks for each shot they made during this round. Also, the {g|Encyclopedia:BurstAttacksGlossary}burst{/g} attack grants an additional +10 stacks of never stop shooting.
89acdfa0-1639-4f20-9b8d-1d1d6577e8d3: Every time Pasqal uses plasma or melta weapons, he regains 1 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g}.
5069cbcc-181d-4f00-8bb5-54d74a5cae86:
Every time Pasqal uses plasma or melta weapons, his {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} with these weapons increases by +{uip|DamageBonus|be49079e9e4c4f2aa84d04d8440e1859}%. Stacks.
If Pasqal does not shoot for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}, he loses all stacks.
3d9f7d23-a7b1-4384-b40d-5f41df7d4733: Every time the Astra Militarum commander's ally uses a {g|Encyclopedia:HeroicAct}heroic act{/g}, the commander gains +5 to all of their {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristics{/g} until the end of combat.
20386b15-f136-4d97-9775-658c968953fc:
Every {g|Encyclopedia:Injury}Injury{/g} increases the death world character's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerAgility}Agility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWillpower}Willpower{/g} by +5.
Every {g|Encyclopedia:Traumas}trauma{/g} counts as 3 Injuries.
4e5edb3e-443c-4cec-8396-d870a18183e6: Every {g|Encyclopedia:PerilsOfWarp}perils of the warp{/g} increases {g|Encyclopedia:MomentumWithDetailsGlossary}momentum{/g} by +{uip|Momentum|6f138a487f0140ee94c171547f982b68}.
19ebd2ab-c0a9-4664-98e5-bbc89775797e: Falsely accused of cowardice, you were forced to suffer through a humiliating tribunal.
32a5f891-0ab4-4707-b99d-cd2c96ddb1b9: Fenris is a death world of fire and ice, located on the fringe of the Segmentum Solar and home to the Space Wolves Chapter of the Adeptus Astartes. Each planetary year, Fenris goes through a cycle of devastating cataclysms, which has turned its inhabitants into hardened and unyielding warriors, from whose number only the select few are deemed worthy to bolster the ranks of the Space Marines of Leman Russ.
69a1565a-a07c-4ba6-a90f-7b822250c554: Forge Worlds are the domain of the Adeptus Mechanicus. Entire planets ceded to the demands of vast macro-industries, each is a manufacturing super-complex of unimaginable capacity and power. Over the millennia, different forge worlds have become especially renowned for their philosophies or ways of war. These are often coloured by the technologies they specialise in manufacturing. The bulk of a forge worlds population is utilised as a labour force, whilst the fortunate few may be inducted into the ranks of the Adeptus Mechanicus itself.
b50de84c-93f9-4292-90df-4a65c6c4068a: Forge world characters can use {g|Encyclopedia:SkillPersuasion}Persuasion{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:SkillCoercion}Coercion{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:SkillCommerce}Commerce{/g} based on {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerIntelligence}Intelligence{/g} instead of {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerFellowship}Fellowship{/g}.
46f84590-71e9-493b-98d0-50d83a695341:
Forge world characters choose one augmentation system from the following list:
-<indent=5%>Subskin {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerArmourGlossary}Armour{/g}: grants +<u>(5 + 2 × {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerToughness}TGH{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g})</u>% armour.</indent>
-<indent=5%>Locomotion System: grants +<u>({g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerAgility}AGI{/g} bonus / 2)</u> {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}MP{/g} and +<u>(2 × AGI bonus)</u>% {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g}.</indent>
-<indent=5%>Analytics System: grants +<u>(10 + {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerIntelligence}INT{/g} bonus)</u>% {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit chance{/g}.</indent>
19500878-8f21-42c5-9992-bafdf7669631: Forge world characters gain +{uip|CritChance|96fd88d5d1fe4ba1a35746cde88aaf3c}% {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit chance{/g}.
81e369e7-7630-4748-8e62-68a836260b17: Forge world characters gain +{unit_stat|WarhammerToughness|bonus} {g|Encyclopedia:Deflection}deflection{/g} against the {g|Encyclopedia:BurningEffect}burning{/g} effect and flame weapons.
65c9f975-902c-4f96-9ca4-4deb73fca18c:
Forge world characters gain a stacking +10% {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:HitSequenceGlossary}hit chance{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeReduction}dodge reduction{/g} against any target they hit with a single-target attack.
Successful {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hits{/g} from single-target attacks increase the hit chance and {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} reduction by +20%.
3ce453b1-dd58-49a5-ba91-49538ce778e2: Fortress world characters gain +7 to {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerPerception}Perception{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWillpower}Willpower{/g} while in combat. Yet while out of combat, their {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerIntelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerFellowship}Fellowship{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerPerception}Perception{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWillpower}Willpower{/g} are decreased by −7.
1e49df52-3899-483c-9228-8fabb928870e: Fortress world characters' first {g|Encyclopedia:Reload}reload{/g} in combat costs 0 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g}. Reloading a weapon grants an additional +10 stacks of never stop shooting.
e8042522-8f8b-4b03-a46b-b66fa4c28664: Fortress worlds are planets, where the entire populace is immersed in warfare; they constantly train for the day that they may be called upon to defend the Imperium, a charge they solemnly uphold. Fortress worlds are established as bulwarks against the enemy. Every citizen is a soldier, trained to fight from the moment they can handle a weapon.
78081c00-1e71-4247-8f4e-b7391b9f634d: Hive world characters can pass {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWillpower}Willpower{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:ResistanceTest}resistance tests{/g} using their {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerFellowship}Fellowship{/g} value instead, if the character's Fellowship is higher.
8362249b-472d-4b00-b1fe-bbceed51934a:
Hive world characters gain +{uip|Resolve|33ece001a1ec47c19dca4ddc8435c249} {g|Encyclopedia:Resolve}resolve{/g} if there are 3 or more creatures (allies or enemies) in a 3-cell radius.
Yet they suffer a −2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to resolve with no creatures around.
9ce05126-af22-4509-944a-50251382f3e5: Hive world characters gain a +50% {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} against the first {g|Encyclopedia:AttackOfOpportunityFullGlossary}attack of opportunity{/g} every {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}.
04831615-a052-4299-9128-e8a39927bbfc: If a hive world character has {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeSuperiority}melee superiority{/g} against the enemy, the effect is increased by +10. If an enemy has {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee{/g} superiority against a hive world character, the effect is decreased by −10. Melee Superiority: in melee combat, any target surrounded by more allies then enemies receives a +10 {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} for each additional ally. Larger creatures need to be surrounded by more than two enemies to provide this advantage to the attackers.
fdc33a3f-b2f8-4696-a604-f260b000edc0:
If a hive world character starts their {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g} adjacent to an ally character, that hive world character gains +2 {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}MP{/g}.
If a hive world character ends their turn adjacent to allies, they all gain +2 MP on their next turn.
dc59264d-945e-4661-ac08-2cb795398a68: If a noble uses an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g} on their servant, the servant gains +1 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} next {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}. Does not stack with itself.
f83d8c0e-39ef-4b6d-ba1f-cb61fac0b4a6: If at the start of a {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}, the crime lord has no stacks of sure-fire plan, they gain +1 stack.
a440e8b4-520b-4ad0-9f10-2ac79921ca65: If no other character in the current party has the same archetype as this character, the first use of any {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g} from this {g|Encyclopedia:Career}archetype{/g} cost −1 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} less.
4c3ed7fb-19c6-4365-9a45-737dba4c2657: If the Commissar kills the target with At All Costs!, they can use At All Costs! once more this combat for 0 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g}.
d49b570c-9588-42a7-9fb1-ebf1b131a23e: If the noble and the servant are adjacent to each other at the start of the noble's {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}, they both gain {g|Encyclopedia:TemporaryWounds}temporary wounds{/g} equal to <u>servant's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerToughness}TGH{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}</u> or <u>noble's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerFellowship}FEL{/g} bonus</u> depending on which is higher.
12b42d14-b363-4f53-92c7-c7eeeb8a7697: If the servant has less than 30% {g|Encyclopedia:MaxWounds}maximum wounds{/g}, the noble can use You. Serve Me. once more in battle, designating a new servant and removing the effect from the previous one. The noble cannot designate a character who already was their servant this combat.
d30319fd-8c37-42c6-8733-3bfd8e129f2e: If the servant kills the target that the noble dealt {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} to last {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}, the noble gains +1 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} next turn.
86ddda6c-ca8c-454e-bbb3-7d9995a9d4df: Imperial world characters can select any {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristic{/g} (except for {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g}) and add a +10 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}.
01d6ab8e-b0fa-4095-b14d-21f742080253:
Imperial world characters gain +10% {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit chance{/g} and +10% {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerArmourGlossary}armour{/g} against xenos or daemonic creatures. Their allies gain half the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} of know no heresy.
However, Imperial world characters' {g|Encyclopedia:SkillLoreXenos}Lore (Xenos){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:SkillLoreWarp}Lore (Warp){/g} are always 0.
41151b8e-5769-4d23-9452-b881221516fc: Jae can use either {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerFellowship}Fellowship{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerIntelligence}Intelligence{/g} for Intelligence-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, whichever is higher. Additionally, Jae can reroll failed {g|Encyclopedia:SkillCommerce}Commerce{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Test}tests{/g} (+1 attempt for each test).
c4882118-702b-4ab4-8298-4cbefb523b39: On death worlds, the plants, beasts, and sometimes even the environment itself take aggressive and destructive forms inimical to human life. Whilst exceptionally difficult to colonise, many death worlds possess valuable resources that require an outpost or other human presence upon the planet's surface to harvest. These harsh environments result in some of the hardiest and most resilient populations in the galaxy. Those tested and found wanting die young.
ed745652-b73a-428f-b28c-b73cece6aa95: Once in your past, when the temptation of easy gains got the better of you, you resorted to piracy and were caught red-handed.
5c64add2-1740-4827-b2b0-745d93d024b1: Once per combat, if the crime lord has at least 1 stack of sure-fire plan, they do not die from lethal {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g}. Instead, they heal <u>(5 × sure-fire plan stacks)</u>% of {g|Encyclopedia:MaxWounds}maximum wounds{/g}, lose all stacks, and can no longer gain sure-fire plan stacks.
9fbd89f6-faf6-40ec-a2b4-2b6d091d6f1d: Once per combat, when a death world character is suffering from the {g|Encyclopedia:Stun}stunned{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:BlindedEffect}blinded{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:ImmobilisedEffect}immobilised{/g} condition, this condition is ignored, and they instead gain +20% {g|Encyclopedia:TemporaryWounds}temporary wounds{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:MaxWounds}maximum wounds{/g}.
f2d365c4-2ad9-4aaa-900d-07594a1f0966:
Once per combat, when the {g|Encyclopedia:HitPoints}wounds{/g} of a death world character drop below 30%, they gain +20% of their {g|Encyclopedia:MaxWounds}maximum wounds{/g} as {g|Encyclopedia:TemporaryWounds}temporary wounds{/g}.
Death world characters also gain a +20% {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerArmourGlossary}armour{/g} while they have at least 1 temporary wound from any source.
beb75f20-93e3-4aa9-a180-4009133da0fb: Pasqal gains +{uip|BallisticSkillBonus|e6fe1cf5410642be85f0ea27ef38c801} to {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} and +{uip|DodgeReduction|e6fe1cf5410642be85f0ea27ef38c801}% to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeReduction}dodge reduction{/g} with plasma and melta weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Range}ranged{/g} attacks.
d1ba3917-7ea9-4cca-ad70-01dedd0868b7:
Pasqal gains +{uip|DodgeParryReduction|ef6a2442104a4768b0ef26c8a66b1201}% to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeReduction}dodge reduction{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:ParryReduction}parry reduction{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee{/g} weapons.
If an enemy {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodges{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parries{/g} his attack, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} is doubled for the next melee attack against this enemy.
bd4b0d85-d5c4-4e14-a4fd-bd5a859a8c17: Pasqal gains {unit_stat|WarhammerIntelligence|bonus} {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}MP{/g} in the first {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g} of combat. Every successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee attack{/g} grants Pasqal +{uip|MovementPoints|936867432ffa496786eef7e36336746e} MP for the next round.
c9f9e7df-7a09-4005-b08b-f7d741d04568: Pasqal's attacks and effects of the Expose Weakness {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g} gain {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} against enemies under the effects of machine spirit communion, as if those enemies had 2 more stacks of {g|Encyclopedia:Exploit}exploit{/g}.
b2047405-6974-47c3-a714-333cc5ad844b: Pasqal's {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee attacks{/g} apply the machine spirit communion effect on all attacked enemies.
18e9dd77-f3bb-4383-baf7-201d4f8bef0e: Psykers are feared and distrusted but are nonetheless valuable assets to the Imperium. The role of the Adeptus Astra Telepathica is to recruit, identify, and classify those found to possess psychic {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g}. The most powerful who somehow survive the rigorous sanctioning rituals are selected to serve on the battlefield. The mind of a sanctioned psyker is steeled against the manifold dangers risked by wielders of warp powers. You were one of those found worthy to serve Humanity and have miraculously survived the {g|Encyclopedia:PerilsOfWarp}perils of the warp{/g}.
b52598f9-e2ca-4b93-a477-ef895fb8a4eb: Psykers of the sanctic discipline master their connection to the Golden Throne to support their allies with holy might and stave off daemons and heretics.
76cc2ce3-f6e7-48ea-80ff-b8b083f5eb46: Pyromancers specialise in producing and manipulating flames to maim their enemies and burn them to ash.
8637f5df-70cd-4f9b-a241-076c1e6c0f44: Reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} dealt from the target's attacks by −{uip|DamageReduction|0b8058ef3f33406faebea94ee7967d66}% for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}. Targets with the Reject the Flesh feature suffer {uip|Damage|0b8058ef3f33406faebea94ee7967d66} {g|Encyclopedia:ShockDamage}shock damage{/g}. If the target is a mechanism or a machine, it suffers {uip|StatReduction|0b8058ef3f33406faebea94ee7967d66} shock damage instead, and its {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristics{/g} are reduced by −{uip|StatReduction|0b8058ef3f33406faebea94ee7967d66} until the end of combat.
589042f7-18cb-4551-a436-ecf7228caaf4: Telepaths use their {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}psychic powers{/g} in conjunction with their own minds to delude, control, and destroy the minds of their enemies.
2955dfef-3bd6-4f9b-9dc2-d172104dd143: The Astra Militarum, commonly known as the Imperial Guard, is the primary fighting force of the Imperium and the first line of defence from the myriad threats that endanger the existence of Humanity in the 41st Millennium. You have served as one of the commanders of an Astra Militarum regiment, commanding thousands and winning battles in the name of the God-Emperor.
11b15c73-7f0f-4896-820f-4c8661dcab9a:
The Commissar's next {g|Encyclopedia:SingleRangedAttacksGlossary}single-shot{/g} or single-target {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee attack{/g} applies the following effects:
-<indent=5%>Enemy Target: The target becomes marked. The ally who kills the marked enemy gains an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g} after the current one with +2 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} and +4 {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}MP{/g}.</indent>
-<indent=5%>Allied Target: all allies gain an additional +1 AP and +3 MP for the next {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}.</indent>{br}
! Can only be used once per combat.
! The Commissar themselves cannot gain {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} from this {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g}.
8c1a284e-87ed-45a1-a131-a28942db2cee: The Ecclesiarchy, known formally as the Adeptus Ministorum, is a vast institution that oversees the galaxy-spanning religion of the Imperium. The Ecclesiarchy's complex hierarchies of cardinals, missionaries, preachers, and zealous laity ensure the prescribed prayers and invocations are made, all the while instructing the masses to guard against heresy and deviancy. You used to be one of those fiery and charismatic individuals concerned with keeping a close watch on your congregation.
9ce89208-3b86-4b04-b274-6d2fcd874d21: The Imperial Navy is responsible for the fleets of voidships that assert the dominance of the Imperium amid the stars and fulfil other duties connected to the void and warp travel. You used to be a Navy {g|Encyclopedia:CareerLeaderGlossary}officer{/g} and a commander of a voidship, hardened in numerous battles and famous for resounding victories.
ec7eecc4-0dd9-42b3-b0ce-a94e44f64574: The Imperium survives and prospers in no small part due to the narrowness of its vision, but a rebellious mind and will such as yours could not be so easily constrained. The dark paths of smugglers and renegades that wind behind the facade of the Imperium's society offer a dangerous refuge for those unwilling to bow to the law. You used to be one of these dangerous yet resourceful individuals.
a92cafbe-79a5-4068-94ab-c6849e9ed9db: The devotee and their allies in the {g|Encyclopedia:AreaOfEffect}area of effect{/g} of War Hymn of Furious Recital gain +{uip|DamageBonus|10a6dc3267d14009a0e302927bb7fcfe} {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:SingleRangedAttacksGlossary}single shots{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:AttackOfOpportunityFullGlossary}attacks of opportunity{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}.
0e930f3f-da5b-4f0c-a185-216fafae90d8:
The devotee gains +{uip|ArmourBonus|c5acfe1f0e02491cb86047de9b200e48}% to {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerArmourGlossary}armour{/g} against attacks of daemons and {g|Encyclopedia:WarpDamage}warp damage{/g}.
The devotee's {g|Encyclopedia:Resolve}resolve{/g} is also permanently increased by {uip|ResolveBonus|c5acfe1f0e02491cb86047de9b200e48}.
f9436260-f433-4b3d-a96b-0d5e34aa0959: The devotee gains a {unit_stat|WarhammerWillpower|bonus}% chance to ignore any enemy attack.
44315fcb-b6bc-472a-982c-b055c26b92d6:
The first attack in combat with any plasma, melta, or power weapon deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} equal to {unit_stat|WarhammerIntelligence|bonus}.
For the remainder of combat, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} damage is decreased to {uip|DamageBonus|4563725badc446ccab8413bbb0b9b287}.
ffe6da7d-eca6-4504-b926-7d983614a9ed: The first time in combat that an ally becomes the target of the psyker's {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}psychic power{/g}, this ally gains +10 to {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerBallisticSkill}Ballistic Skill{/g} until end of combat.
b9c8e253-df42-43f4-b891-5ca519101182: The high nobility of the Imperium are an enormously privileged and powerful elite, a breed apart from the common masses they rule. You grew into adulthood upon a pedestal of affluence and grandeur that towered high above the common masses. You expected their obedience and lived upon the fruits of their toil surrendered to your family in solemn fealty.
a9b6d0e4-a6b9-4496-b7e9-e289273c9db8: The mysterious tome that was discovered in your family library exacted a terrible toll on your mind.
5bba490a-4994-474c-ad7c-9fb421feb7a4:
The noble assigns one ally who will become their servant until the end of combat.
Any time the noble's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g} affect the servant, the servant gains +5 to all {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristics{/g} until the start of the noble's next {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
Any time the servant attacks a target that the noble dealt {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} to last turn, the servant gains +<u>(10 + noble's {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerFellowship}FEL{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g})</u>% {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit{/g} chance against that target.{br}
! Can only be used once per combat.
f7936f2f-6c10-48e5-b329-83a69af08013:
The noble assigns one ally who will become their servant until the end of combat.
Any time the noble's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}abilities{/g} affect the servant, the servant gains +5 to all {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristics{/g} until the start of the noble's next {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
Any time the servant attacks a target that the noble dealt {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} to last turn, the servant gains +{uip|CriticalChance|b826d0a5600e44f7b6272750584bfca0}% {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit{/g} chance against that target.
Can only be used once per combat.
26a33ec3-7dc6-4e34-b443-55604868c776: The noble's servant gains +2 {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}movement points{/g} every {g|Encyclopedia:Turn}turn{/g}.
8801365d-0481-4277-91b6-22077705829b: The planet of Leira lies in the deeper reaches of the Koronus Expanse. After a prolonged loss of contact with the Imperium, its population descended into heresy and turned to sorcery and forbidden knowledge to ensure their own survival and welfare.
a7e0999e-f8ee-40a6-af9a-637cb71b3897: The power of your sorcery crushed a daemon of the Archenemy and drove it back into the warp.
2aa3ae3a-ef2c-44eb-a0f8-b5f45c04374d: The psyker gains +5 {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWillpower}Willpower{/g} while under the effect of any allied {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}psychic power{/g}, navigator power, or {g|Encyclopedia:Career}doctrine{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g}. This {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} increases by +2 for every other such ability affecting the psyker. If the bonus to Willpower from this {g|Encyclopedia:Talent}talent{/g} is higher than 15, this talent also grants a +1 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:PsyRating}psy rating{/g}.
0ff79df8-7380-4971-b4c1-d004a3b84c56: The psyker gains a +<u>(3 × {g|Encyclopedia:PsyRating}psy rating{/g})</u> {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to all {g|Encyclopedia:ResistanceTest}resistance tests{/g} and can use {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}psychic powers{/g} while {g|Encyclopedia:Stun}stunned{/g} or being unable to act in any another way.
125c900b-fdd3-4e9d-a741-871224d67431: The psyker gains the Inscribed Soul {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g}. It costs no {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} but deals {g|Encyclopedia:DirectDamage}direct damage{/g} to the psyker equal to 25% of the psyker's {g|Encyclopedia:MaxWounds}maximum wounds{/g}. The next {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}psychic power{/g} used after this ability will not trigger {g|Encyclopedia:PsychicPhenomena}psychic phenomena{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:PerilsOfWarp}perils of the warp{/g} and will not degrade the {g|Encyclopedia:VeilThickness}veil{/g}.
1a584196-795f-47a5-a840-f6f9f2dd15ed: The psyker suffers −<u>(5 × {g|Encyclopedia:PsyRating}psy rating{/g})</u>% less {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} from {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}psychic powers{/g} and becomes immune to the effects of {g|Encyclopedia:PerilsOfWarp}perils of the warp{/g} triggered by other psykers.
0930c0f8-8add-4c4e-a4f8-e7fbc281ab74: The psyker's {g|Encyclopedia:Resolve}resolve{/g} is increased by +{uip|ResolveBonus|5f569e5e1dbe4271aa3b22f3cbf69e8c} while {g|Encyclopedia:VeilThickness}veil degradation{/g} is 10 or lower.
71234e00-4296-4983-9383-070a5d7e1b62: The souls of all who perished in a brutal offensive still haunt your nightmares and torture your soul.
06b40c63-d53d-43fd-9dea-1c2ece9441dc: The voidborn character has a 20% chance to survive after suffering lethal {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g}, surviving with 1 {g|Encyclopedia:HitPoints}wound{/g}.
971cdb14-a027-415d-8f15-666bd6b14b68: The {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g} from sure-fire plan are increased by +{uip|AdditionalDodge|1badb7fcaefb458a947f78ead3795587}% . Dodging or parrying at least one attack by the start of the next {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g} restores 1 stack of sure-fire plan.
185ef885-5fd4-4cdb-a8d8-0f7529843e9b: The {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} of sure-fire plan is increased by +{uip|DamageBonus|d29bd0cb21184342a09e7b928eaac0dc}%. Killing at least one enemy with an attack restores 1 stack of sure-fire plan.
b002ca60-d181-4f85-8a31-b061479e7745: Through reforms and leadership, you restored a broken Imperial Guard regiment to its former martial glory.
f28d1188-9d36-48d2-ba01-693cfb18b30e: Ulfar immediately moves to the target, ignoring {g|Encyclopedia:AttackOfOpportunityFullGlossary}attacks of opportunity{/g}, and performs a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee attack{/g} with +<u>(10 + 2 x {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerStrength}STR{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g})% {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical damage{/g}.
76af0dfb-c70a-4022-82cd-c42b88d7d195:
Ulfar unleashes the instincts of the Wulfen, succumbing to a morose anger.
Ulfar reduces his {g|Encyclopedia:Resolve}resolve{/g} to 0 for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g} but gains +20 {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerStrength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWeaponSkill}Weapon Skill{/g} instead.
Every time he deals any {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} to an enemy this round, all enemies must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWillpower}Willpower{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:ResistanceTest}resistance test{/g} or suffer +4% to {g|Encyclopedia:CritChancesAndCritDamageGlossary}critical hit{/g} chance and +8% critical damage against incoming attacks until the end of combat.{br}
! Can only be used once per combat.
890d5de4-2978-44b8-9e8e-67f02cc3387a: Under your command, a voidship braved a terrible warp storm without a single casualty among the crew.
50af873c-c0d3-47ec-ac5f-c300762def0d: Upon solving the mystery of a powerful psychically active xeno-artefact, you managed to destroy the creation of countless enemies of Humanity.
86d156e8-2efc-491b-a178-9c7d41822b87:
Using a non-damaging {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g} on an ally grants that ally the ability to reroll any failed attack, {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeGlossary}dodge{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Parry}parry{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristic{/g}, or skill {g|Encyclopedia:Test}test{/g} with a 20% chance of success for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}. This chance cannot be greater than the base success chance of the roll.
Using a non-damaging ability on an enemy grants them a 20% chance to fail a successful dodge or parry test against any character for 1 round.
0277f893-24a6-4420-8fc8-c3e6119473b6: Voidborn are humans birthed in the belly of a void vessel or aboard an ancient orbital satellite. Those who have lived their lives on voidships become inured to some extent due to the reality-altering process of warp travel and to living in low- or zero-gravity environments. In many cases, their features are drawn and their skin pallid. They may even have minor deformities, or a strangeness to their speech, gait, or general appearance that sets them apart from others.
de1e7980-c6f8-4894-b0ae-3dab93ea4fe3:
When all stacks of never stop shooting should be lost, they become <u>({g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerWillpower}WP{/g} / 2)</u> number of stacks instead.
Additionally, a fortress world character may upgrade their Willpower {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristic{/g} even if their current archetypes do not allow it.
9af56a02-1d55-420d-939b-97cb35cf5a7f: When an Imperial world character is affected by an ally's non-damaging {g|Encyclopedia:Ability}ability{/g} or affects an ally with such an ability, their {g|Encyclopedia:Resolve}resolve{/g} is increased by {uip|Resolve|ede94fd520554c3288633197b1f11bdc} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}.
29e15873-c24a-4146-85d0-6601429e6c82: When {g|Encyclopedia:MomentumWithDetailsGlossary}momentum{/g} is less than 100 points, killing the marked enemy or targeting an ally grants +{uip|Momentum|fa3d22a15b2d47cea26872abed3ad70f} momentum.
359ad1f1-ebe3-44a8-9ee8-613e0cd14d6a: While Jae is fighting with weapons in both hands, the attack from the second hand (depending on which hand she attacked with first in the {g|Encyclopedia:Round}round{/g}) does not cost any additional {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g}.
92d07a61-2410-414f-bce7-17190451edb9: While Pasqal is under the effects of machine spirit communion, his {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee attacks{/g} deal an additional +{uip|DamageBonus|5701e2340b9249f48bb57f51b6ad4848} {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} and gain +{uip|PenetrationBonus|5701e2340b9249f48bb57f51b6ad4848}% {g|Encyclopedia:ArmourPenetration}armour penetration{/g}.
3218d97d-299a-4640-acd9-3e9e90c89e85:
While a voidborn character has more than 50% {g|Encyclopedia:HitPoints}wounds{/g}, all chances of all creatures (including enemies) in a 3-cell radius are increased by +10%.
While a voidborn character has less than 50% wounds, all chances of all creatures (including enemies) in a 3-cell radius are decreased by −10%.
81dc24a8-4356-4b25-b2a3-29144b189aff: While the Astra Militarum commander is adjacent to any ally, the commander deals an additional +{uip|DamageBonus|dd8a80be418043908ce3431dbfb8ac82}% {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} to all enemies adjacent to the commander's allies. This stacks with Regimental Tactics.
df0ac38f-e0e5-423b-8d8e-7066a6c14c1a: While the Astra Militarum commander is under the Regimental Tactics effect, all their allies gain +5% to {g|Encyclopedia:RateOfFire}rate of fire{/g} for every attack they have made since the start of this effect.
2230c701-bc58-481e-9635-5130c9f61ba7: While the Astra Militarum commander is under the Regimental Tactics effect, killing an enemy adjacent to any ally grants that ally an additional +10 {g|Encyclopedia:MomentumWithDetailsGlossary}momentum{/g}.
6eb8ed68-a538-4a4b-a8a1-5c0592ec904e: While the Astra Militarum commander is under the Regimental Tactics effect, their single target {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}melee{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Range}ranged{/g} attacks, and {g|Encyclopedia:AreaOfEffect}area attacks{/g} gain +20% to {g|Encyclopedia:DodgeReduction}dodge reduction{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:ParryReduction}parry reduction{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:DetailsOfTheCoverGlossary}cover penetration{/g} against enemies adjacent to the commander or their allies.
1de5f70d-5ab7-4eef-bf4f-d3ef0f74ce56: While the Commissar is adjacent to an enemy, all their allies gain +{uip|Resolve|d61fbaba9fe34b6697efe57f3c5e8574} {g|Encyclopedia:Resolve}resolve{/g}.
08949fe8-09f4-4a4d-b4af-43cb1e55917b: While the Commissar's ally is under the effects of At All Costs!, that ally suffers +50% {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} but gains +2 {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} and +4 {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}MP{/g} (instead of +1 AP and +3 MP).
43f86ac3-4360-4b9e-8ded-d5cc50634ee7: While under 40% {g|Encyclopedia:HitPoints}wounds{/g}, Imperial world characters gain a +10 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to all {g|Encyclopedia:Characteristic}characteristics{/g} and +2 to {g|Encyclopedia:Resolve}resolve{/g}.
d17c9506-4f8e-4488-a0d3-4fbcdac5c6de: While wearing {g|Encyclopedia:HeavyArmour}heavy armour{/g}, forge world characters gain +1 {g|Encyclopedia:MovementPoints}MP{/g}, +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Deflection}deflection{/g}, and cannot fall {g|Encyclopedia:ProneEffect}prone{/g}.
b37c4eea-b01b-4075-8f0a-548136f8baa7: You and your Guardsmen defended a shrine world and received a high commendation for your feat.
6bf9755b-b04f-4bd8-9914-8b835fd2ba59: You are a bastard, an illegitimate member of a family that immediately turned its back on you.
73853d80-3237-4406-bdd8-808fde7eafd7: You directed a heroic attack of an Imperial Guard regiment that breached the gates of a fortress held by heretics.
eece3870-2a42-4010-b54b-9f1d6f4a9f20: You had a rival noble house's reputation destroyed and its members exiled from the sector.
2115a959-1ae0-45ad-9fbc-44891ba4d821: You have been deemed a worthy successor to a higher-ranked hierchon of the Ecclesiarchy.
213e0e8f-4d5d-4f48-900c-d5d23716eee4: You have journeyed through dark and forsaken systems, and the things you have seen have left a mark on your soul that will never heal.
ca80747b-6830-4a34-a595-52692d0ad15a: You heroically rescued a priceless relic of the Imperium from the clutches of heretics.
c35b3d3f-cac2-4ac5-a7ab-90db7488b0b0: You lost an entire regiment to the Immaterium during a Geller field failure, yet you yourself emerged unscathed.
ec323bc4-d7f1-4615-8b7d-46082020a771: You lured a pirate squadron into the gravitational tear of a star, thereby destroying the whole fleet through your cunning alone.
ecdaac03-ef9d-4383-aa1f-d61f45cecd25: You managed to corrupt an entire star system and turn it into your personal den of thieves.
311e0be4-2e9d-497d-aac0-5553e1a85bda: You played a key role in exposing a conspiracy among your superior officers in the Astra Militarum.
edf9b495-9813-4acf-940b-b012875671f7: You prevailed in a bloody shadow war against the void pirates of your sector.
2a3efbb8-6bfa-4356-8579-7420bcda386c: You renounced your mentor and testified against him in the Ecclesiarchy's court.
c190679e-4b7b-476f-aaf9-13f7244f814f: You single-handedly saved a pilgrim ship by stopping a warp breach while travelling through the Immaterium.
6e6a9856-d304-4c56-ae65-9a219020ceb5: You stripped an Ecclesiarchy cardinal of a priceless treasure that had been kept in one of the most secure sanctums of the Adeptus Ministorum.
9ae7ed1c-7288-4b90-a865-cf7f4908e410: You turned your partners in to the authorities and became known as a traitor.
671828a5-e3cf-4089-bc0e-30e6846c6f0d: You utilised your talents as a commander to achieve a great victory over the Ruinous Powers.
020c0b0f-16a0-4971-976a-8231dc76acca: You were accused of being possessed by a warp entity and forced into exile, leaving your soul forever scarred.
cf9864d2-ff11-4477-8c9f-e1b3808a6aa4: You were arrested and thoroughly interrogated using creative and violent methods.
37a32d04-a54a-4c2a-96e6-dc493a8c8e7f: You were attacked by a group of renegade Guardsmen during a mutiny and were beaten half to death.
6bf95a2a-ba81-4761-b25b-008f9a8dde1a: You were kidnapped for ransom, and your captors mistreated you up until the moment you were released.
c5eff6f4-003b-4afb-8690-1a56e34af961: You were named planetary governor and survived, having made useful connections on both sides of the law.
4b214aa8-7a29-499d-a210-f2c0d3462934: Your name has become a synonym for loyalty and valour, and your visage has adorned many Imperial Guard propaganda posters.
ed584ea8-be85-4248-940f-385584ead3a0: Your ordainment took place after a trial of faith by devotional torture.
e06e860e-3785-4817-a655-14f887aae33b: Your sermons are dark and ominous, for the visions that inspired you were just as lightless and disturbing.
0be957a1-272a-4fb2-8e2f-cd5175c46548: Your ship became the first to take a now-reclaimed warp route to a cluster of Humanity's lost worlds.
2c6a3804-8405-45a2-bc1f-d07f2d0e0eee: Your ship was boarded by pirates and you barely survived, enduring many horrors during your time in captivity.
4d8b7651-bf6b-4226-9bb8-4ef7082c7393: Your sorcery caused a warp manifestation aboard a voidship, claiming thousands of lives in the end.
bbd3ffee-4217-4ef0-8f33-1e5a93bfbc22: Your strong presence and persuasiveness stopped a feudal war between neighbouring systems.
d98d171e-68be-4bcc-93f4-70a4c3ad80d4:
{g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttacksGlossary}Melee{/g}, flame, and melta attacks against daemons and psykers deal an additional +{uip|WeaponDamage|825a60180393428a96e4008a0579afe7} {g|Encyclopedia:DamageGlossary}damage{/g} and gain +{uip|WeaponPenetration|825a60180393428a96e4008a0579afe7}% {g|Encyclopedia:ArmourPenetration}armour penetration{/g}.
Such attacks against xenos deal an additional +{unit_stat|WarhammerWillpower|bonus} damage and gain +{uip|XenosPenetration|825a60180393428a96e4008a0579afe7}% {g|Encyclopedia:WarhammerArmourGlossary}armour{/g} penetration.
bc96edb5-790b-4340-a028-b9ebda4e6c83: {g|Encyclopedia:PsykerPowersGlossary}Psychic powers{/g} have a 25% chance to regain {g|Encyclopedia:ActionPoints}AP{/g} spent on psychic powers when {g|Encyclopedia:VeilThickness}veil degradation{/g} is 10 or lower.
